Articles.Content:
Good evening, fellow Kerbonauts! Today I am pleased to introduce the M-2/C 'Munitaur II', an advanced two stage lander.

Capable of reaching the Mun, Minmus, or even both in one mission, this vehicle is guaranteed to satisfy all your landing needs.

Here is the lander attached to the Wyvern launch vehicle. I've been able to fly it to the Mun while keeping the throttle

maxed as much as possible, so it should still make it after the fuel consumption bug is fixed.

It's also quite durable. I've run it at full throttle from launch to munar insertion many times without a single decoupler

failure. It does tend to oscillate in a disturbing way however.

If you like to keep useless debris out of orbit, you'll apreciate that the Munitaur is completely debris-less. Mostly.

The final stage of the launcher can be left in orbit, but it's easy to crash it into the munar surface. Obviously, the descent stage

is also left behind on the surface.

Personally, I'm very proud of this lander. It's easy to fly, it carries both an ASAS unit and RCS without a ridiculous looking

tower sitting on the nose, and is just a good, all-around Mun lander. And I just think it looks cool.

UPDATE:

I used some of your suggestions and improved the design of the Munitaur. The launcher has more fuel and RCS thrusters on the final booster, and I also managed to cram an extra RCS tank into the ascent stage.

Edited September 9, 2012 by Foursh
Wow - very well done! I really like this.
I am in love with the Ascent/Return Stage!! Well Done

What a beautiful rocket!

I wish someday I'll be able to finally build a rocket that won't have to melt my motherboard to get into orbit, and leave a trail of fuel tanks on the way to the Mun as if my astronauts were Hansel and Gretel...
Wow, Very nice. The lander reminds me of the Altair moon lander:
Very nice! I'd even say EPIC!!!!! Feel free to upload the file.
The craft file should be attached. Can you not download it?

Nice and tidy - I like it. My only aesthetic issue visible on these screenshots is the struts connecting the lander to the the fuel tanks. Never been a fan of such long struts.

If I'm not mistaken you have added parachutes to your boosters though. Always nice!

The ascent stage doesn't work! I try to fly back*, and it runs out of fuel!

*Using a MechJeb unit mounted to the nose

Edit:I had to inject with the descent stage.

Edited August 9, 2012 by Jeb KerBoom
Left out half!

The craft file should be attached. Can you not download it?

I did download it. (I didn't notice the link at first) I took it for a flight. Very nice with lots of fuel to spare. I liked how easy it was to drive with little to no oscillation from the SAS. The lander itself should be able to do many maneuvers with all that fuel.

Great job! Looks cool too!

Thanks to this I managed my second successful mun landing without autopilot, although I couldn't get back.

Thanks!

I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong, but I can't even get out of the atmosphere with this thing. I get about half way out and it doesn't seem to have enough power to keep going to it gets pulled back down.
What height are you orbiting at before making the transfer to Munar orbit? It doesn't seem to have quite enough fuel to make it.
This is beautiful, I've been looking for a good 3-man mun lander that can return safely, all mine are permanent!
Very nice! Made it to the Mun and back on the first try!

Thanks for all the comments and feedback guys, I really appreciate it.

Nice and tidy - I like it. My only aesthetic issue visible on these screenshots is the struts connecting the lander to the the fuel tanks. Never been a fan of such long struts.

If I'm not mistaken you have added parachutes to your boosters though. Always nice!

You are correct, good sir. Reusable boosters FTW!

As for the struts, you may have a point. It's mostly just personal preference I guess, but it would look a bit cleaner without them, and I don't think they do much anyways.

What height are you orbiting at before making the transfer to Munar orbit? It doesn't seem to have quite enough fuel to make it.

I usually orbit between 72km and 75km.

I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong, but I can't even get out of the atmosphere with this thing. I get about half way out and it doesn't seem to have enough power to keep going to it gets pulled back down.

I... I'm not sure either.

Are you staging it properly? The first few boosters drain pretty quickly.

I am in love with the Ascent/Return Stage!! Well Done

Thanks! That's my favorite part too!

Great looking design! Downloaded.

I usually orbit between 72km and 75km.

That's cutting it a bit fine, don't you think?

Since I started playing with MechJeb, I've gotten used to shooting for its default of 100km, even on manual.
I think it's fine for a parking orbit. Any higher is a waste of fuel, really.
That's a nice landing module. What I like most about it is that it's relatively compact compared to other stock descend-stage/ascend/stage designs I've seen so far.

[ATTACH=CONFIG]31072[/ATTACH]

Thankyou SO MUCH. I've made Kerbin, Mun and Kerbol orbiters before but this was my first mun landing and I did it with YOUR SHIP! It runs super well on my old laptop too and I can run at full throttle without any explosions!

Thankyou SO MUCH. I've made Kerbin, Mun and Kerbol orbiters before but this was my first mun landing and I did it with YOUR SHIP! It runs super well on my old laptop too and I can run at full throttle without any explosions!

That really made my day. I'm glad I could help!

Edited August 11, 2012 by Foursh

I am in love with the Ascent/Return Stage!! Well Done

Ur not the only one, im stealing it just so u know..
This is a fantastic rocket.

Your design let me make my first survived touch down on the moon.

I blew the lander up, but they did survive. I've never managed that before.
Very nice, very stable, i would give this a 11/10, I always have trouble makeing ships to go to the mun.
